resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

nealrichardson commented on a change in pull request #159:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow-site/pull/159#discussion_r744911886



##########
File path: install.md
##########
@@ -154,7 +154,7 @@ For convenience, we also provide packages through several package managers. Many
 Binary conda packages are on [conda-forge][5] for Linux, macOS, and Windows
 for the following versions:
 
-* Python 3.6, 3.7, 3.8, 3.9
+* Python 3.6, 3.7, 3.8, 3.9, 3.10
 * R 3.6, 4.0

Review comment:
       @xhochy should the R versions also be updated? (Are there packages for 4.0 and 4.1 now?) Should we just say "current and past releases" to be future-proof?




--

##########

@@ -154,7 +154,7 @@ For convenience, we also provide packages through several package managers. Many
 Binary conda packages are on [conda-forge][5] for Linux, macOS, and Windows
 for the following versions:
 
-* Python 3.6, 3.7, 3.8, 3.9

   ```suggestion
   * R 4.0, 4.1
   ```

xhochy commented on a change in pull request #159:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow-site/pull/159#discussion_r744914657



##########
File path: install.md
##########
@@ -154,7 +154,7 @@ For convenience, we also provide packages through several package managers. Many
 Binary conda packages are on [conda-forge][5] for Linux, macOS, and Windows
 for the following versions:
 
-* Python 3.6, 3.7, 3.8, 3.9
+* Python 3.6, 3.7, 3.8, 3.9, 3.10
 * R 3.6, 4.0

Review comment:
       > @xhochy should the R versions also be updated? (Are there packages for 4.0 and 4.1 now?) Should we just say "current and past releases" to be future-proof?
   
   It's possibly better to be explicit for people looking up what should be supported.

##########
File path: install.md
##########
@@ -154,7 +154,7 @@ For convenience, we also provide packages through several package managers. Many
 Binary conda packages are on [conda-forge][5] for Linux, macOS, and Windows

Review comment:
       We could also list the architectures here
   ```suggestion
   Binary conda packages are on [conda-forge][5] for Linux (x86_64, aarch64, ppc64le), macOS (x86_64 and arm64), and Windows (x86_64)
   ```




-- 
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

bkmgit commented on a change in pull request #159:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow-site/pull/159#discussion_r744959389



##########
File path: install.md
##########
@@ -154,7 +154,7 @@ For convenience, we also provide packages through several package managers. Many
 Binary conda packages are on [conda-forge][5] for Linux, macOS, and Windows
 for the following versions:
 
-* Python 3.6, 3.7, 3.8, 3.9
+* Python 3.6, 3.7, 3.8, 3.9, 3.10
 * R 3.6, 4.0

Review comment:
       Being clear about what has been tested is very helpful for newcomers. It makes starting use of Arrow much easier and will grow the community. Many of the R builds are for 3.6, probably some policy on which versions to support and for how long will be useful as this will guide updating the versions in CI. 




--

+- name: Benson Muite

   So you don't need this now.
   Could you revert this for now?

kou commented on pull request #159:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow-site/pull/159#issuecomment-963571797


   RubyGems:
   
   ```diff
   diff --git a/install.md b/install.md
   index 62ece0fda..6ea03fa34 100644
   --- a/install.md
   +++ b/install.md
   @@ -235,6 +251,7 @@ Install the Ruby packages from [RubyGems][25] with
    gem install red-arrow
    gem install red-arrow-cuda # For CUDA support
    gem install red-arrow-dataset # For Apache Arrow Dataset support
   +gem install red-arrow-flight # For Apache Arrow Flight support
    gem install red-gandiva # For Gandiva support
    gem install red-parquet # For Apache Parquet support
    gem install red-plasma # For Plasma support
   ```


--

kou commented on a change in pull request #11637:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11637#discussion_r745105263



##########
File path: ruby/red-arrow-cuda/red-arrow-cuda.gemspec
##########
@@ -48,4 +48,5 @@ Gem::Specification.new do |spec|
   spec.add_development_dependency("bundler")
   spec.add_development_dependency("rake")
   spec.add_development_dependency("test-unit")
+  spec.required_ruby_version = Gem::Requirement.new("=> 2.6")

Review comment:
       This is a invalid syntax. `>=` is correct:
   
   ```suggestion
     spec.required_ruby_version = Gem::Requirement.new(">= 2.6")
   ```




--
